org.fluidity.foundation

Class Deferred

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.fluidity.foundation.Utility
      • org.fluidity.foundation.Deferred

  • public final class Deferred
extends Utility
    Lazy instantiation with or without thread safety.

    Usage

     final class LightObject {

   private final Deferred.Factory factory = new Deferred.Factory<HeavyObject>() {
     public HeavyObject create() {
       return new HeavyObject(…);
     }
   }

   private final Deferred.Reference<HeavyObject> reference = Deferred.local(factory);

   …

   private void someMethod() {
     assert reference.invalidate() == null;

     final HeavyObject object = reference.get();
     assert object != null : HeavyObject.class;

     assert object == reference.get();

     assert reference.invalidate() == object;
     assert object != reference.get();
   }
 }

      static interface  Deferred.Reference<T>

    • Method Detail

      • shared

        public static <T> Deferred.Reference<T> shared(Supplier<T> factory)
        Returns a lazy loading reference to some object. The object is instantiated by the given factory's create() method, which will be invoked the first time the returned object's get() method is invoked, and then its return value will be cached for use in subsequent invocations. If the factory returns null instead of an object then the null value will be cached and returned in subsequent queries by the returned reference.

        This reference implements the double-check locking logic with volatile acquire/release semantics to lazily create the referenced object.

        Note: the returned object will maintain a strong reference to the provided factory.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the lazily instantiated object.
        Parameters:
        factory - the factory to create the referred to object.
        Returns:
        a deferred reference to the object created by the given factory.

      • local

        public static <T> Deferred.Reference<T> local(Supplier<T> factory)
        Returns a lazy loading reference to some object. The object is instantiated by the given factory's create() method, which will be invoked the first time the returned object's get() method is invoked, and then its return value will be cached for use in subsequent invocations. If the factory returns null instead of an object then the null value will be cached and returned in subsequent queries by the returned reference.

        This reference implements uses no locking when invoking the given factory.

        Note: the returned object will maintain a strong reference to the provided factory.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the lazily instantiated object.
        Parameters:
        factory - the factory to create the referred to object.
        Returns:
        a deferred reference to the object created by the given factory.

      • label

        public static Deferred.Label label(String format,
                                   Object... arguments)
        Creates a lazy-initialized label from the given format and arguments. The arguments are evaluated every time Deferred.Label.toString() is invoked.
        Parameters:
        format - the Java format specification.
        arguments - the details to format.
        Returns:
        a lazy initialized Deferred.Label object; never null.

      • label

        public static Deferred.Label label(Supplier<String> factory)
        Creates a lazy-initialized label that is produced by the given factory. The factory is invoked at most once when Deferred.Label.toString() is invoked.
        Parameters:
        factory - the factory to produce the label.
        Returns:
        a lazily initialized Deferred.Label object; never null.
